com.littlesaints.protean.functions.streams

Class StreamSource<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.littlesaints.protean.functions.streams.StreamSource<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.stream.Stream<T>>

    public class StreamSource<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.stream.Stream<T>>, java.lang.AutoCloseable
     Function to generate a finite Stream from non-compatible sources. e.g. streaming results from a database.

 It turns the push based approach of retrieving inputs to a Streams like pull based approach.
 This means the application can wire the logic to pull inputs from a Stream but they'll be pulled only upon execution of the terminal operation of the Java Stream.

 Moreover, the application can stop the stream in the following ways:

 1. providing a Predicate doWhile. This will be checked before every call to provider, to get the next element for the stream.
 2. invoking BaseStream.close(). This feature is not available in streams created by Stream.generate(Supplier).
    Since:
    1.0
